chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
n: nat
x: Z_Zp

Goal:
Zp_invertible x -> Zp_invertible (mscal Zp_mult Op n x)

Premises:
Zp_invertible = fun x => exists i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op : Z_Zp -> Prop
mscal : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> nat -> X -> X
Zp_mult = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x * y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x * y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Notation Op := Zp_one
Zp_opp_invertible : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> Zp_invertible (∸ x)
Zp_mult_invertible : forall x y, Zp_invertible x -> Zp_invertible y -> Zp_invertible (x ⊗ y)
Zp_invertible_spec : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z_Zp) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lpe -> (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem lpe in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem n lmp pe1) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul...
Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list Z_Zp), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lH -> forall lmp : list (Z * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol Z), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem lH = lmp -> forall (pe : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z) (npe : Ring_polynom.Pol Z), Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem n lmp pe = npe...
Zp_mult_revert : forall x i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
mscal_comm : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> m (mscal m u n x) y = m y (mscal m u n x)
Zp_one_invertible = ex_intro (fun i : Z_Zp => i ⊗ Op = Op) Op (let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := nil in Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI) Ring_polynom.PEI I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI)) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter...
mscal_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> mscal m u n (m x y) = m (mscal m u n x) (mscal m u n y)
mscal_plus : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (a b : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (a + b) x = m (mscal m u a x) (mscal m u b x)
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
mscal_morph : forall (X Y : Type) (m1 : X -> X -> X) (u1 : X) (m2 : Y -> Y -> Y) (u2 : Y) (phi : X -> Y), phi u1 = u2 -> (forall x y : X, phi (m1 x y) = m2 (phi x) (phi y)) -> forall (n : nat) (x : X), phi (mscal m1 u1 n x) = mscal m2 u2 n (phi x)
mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m x (mscal m u n x)
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p
binomial_Newton : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : X), times a b = times b a -> mscal times one n (sum a b) = msum sum zero (S n) (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero (binomial n i) (times (mscal times one (n - i) a) (mscal times one i b)))
Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
scal_one_comm : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (k : nat) (x : X), times (mscal sum zero k one) x = times x (mscal sum zero k one)
mscal_mult : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (a b : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (a * b) x = mscal m u a (mscal m u b x)
Det22_expo : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall (n : nat) (x : M22 R), Det22 Rplus Rmult Ropp (mscal (MU22 Rplus Rmult) (ID_22 Rzero Rone) n x) = mscal Rmult Rone n (Det22 Rplus Rmult Ropp x)
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Zp_mult_invert : forall x, is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1 -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
is_rel_prime_expo : forall p q l : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 l q) 1
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
scal_one : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (k : nat) (x : X), mscal sum zero k x = times (mscal sum zero k one) x
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
